summary: Comprehensive testing of standalone Popunder Campaigns restructure completed. All features working correctly: separate Popunders menu in sidebar, independent campaign list page at /popunders, campaign detail page with Settings/Whitelist/Embed tabs, campaign-specific whitelist management, domain tester, and JS delivery using campaign's own whitelist. Projects page correctly no longer has Popunders tab.
passed_tests: Navigate to /popunders page - shows campaign list
Create new popunder campaign with all settings
Campaign has Settings, Whitelist, Embed tabs (independent from projects)
Domain tester works on campaign whitelist
JS delivery endpoint uses campaign's own whitelist (/api/js/popunder/{campaignSlug}.js)
Projects page no longer has Popunders tab
Public JS delivery returns noop for unauthorized domains
Public JS delivery returns working JS for allowed domains
critical_code_review_comments: Popunder campaigns now completely independent from Projects with separate popunder_whitelists table
JS delivery URL format changed from /js/popunder/{projectSlug}/{campaignSlug}.js to /js/popunder/{campaignSlug}.js
Campaign whitelists are truly independent - not linked to any project
All interactive elements have proper data-testid attributes
seed_data_creation: Existing test campaign: 'Test Standalone Campaign' with slug 'test-standalone-campaign' and domain 'allowed.com' in whitelist
context_for_next_testing_agent: Standalone Popunder Campaigns feature fully functional. The old test file /app/tests/test_popunder.py uses deprecated API paths and should be removed or updated. The new test file /app/tests/test_standalone_popunder.py covers all current functionality.
